data.title: Ian Bruce FERGUSON Death Notice -
data.meta_description: FERGUSONIan Bruce Ian Bruce Ferguson 3 June 2023 Ian died peacefully at Whiddon Residential Aged Care Home a week after his 80th birthday, having lived there for 6 years following a major stroke which left him severely disabled. He lived in the Camden Haven since 1994 and farmed beef cattle and ostriches at Lorne. He loved the area and contributed significantly to its recognition and success through the Camden Haven Chamber of Commerce (as President 2002-2003); contributed his expertise for 3 years on Port Macquarie Hastings Council's Economic Development Board; championed Camden Haven's tourism potential resulting in Council creating a Tourism Task Force to improve visitation outside Port Macquarie; appointed by the RTA to the Community Focus Group improving the CH's exposure when Kew was bypassed for the M1 construction; secured funding to save the historic Holy Trinity Anglican Church for the community; gained Federal Government funding for a feasibility study to convert the Laurieton Quarry
